p:
The plant species we have considered are resistant, or partially resistant, to some diseases and plant pests. Solanum linnaeanum exhibits resistance to Verticillium wilt and Liu and collaborators (2015) succeeded in the transference of this resistance to eggplants through the introgression of the disease resistance gene
34 . In the same way, if the S. linnaeanum and S. sisymbriifolium resistance genes are isolated, they can be used to confer resistance to plants susceptible to M. chitwoodi, such as tomato and potato plants. They have a potential to be used as sources for resistance to M. chitwoodi in breeding programs.
